plugins.name: TokenBoard
plugins.description:
TokenBoard is an advanced Figma plugin designed to give you full visibility and control over local variable collections — whether you’re building a robust design system, managing light/dark modes, or maintaining consistent styles across teams.


Features Overview


Explore Variables by Collection, Scope & Mode

  1. Browse all local variable collections in your Figma file
  2. Organized as expandable tree structures by collection, group, and nested groups
  3. View and compare values across all modes (e.g. “Light”, “Dark”)


Smart Search

  1. Instant full-text search across variable names, values, types, and scopes
  2. Highlights matches inside nested groups
  3. Keeps scroll position and selection while typing


Visual & Semantic Display

  1. Color tokens show live swatches, hex values, and opacity
  2. Boolean, number, string tokens are clearly labeled
  3. Aliases display as links to target variables with inline previews


Aliases & References

  1. Displays alias chains with resolved values
  2. Clickable interface to explore alias references
  3. Supports setting or detaching aliases via selector popup


Inline Editing of Values

  1. Edit most values directly inside the table: Colors (rgba), Strings, Numbers, Booleans, Aliases
  2. Shows validation states and editable highlights
  3. Supports editing multiple modes in a variable


Selection-Aware Variable Inspector

  1. Automatically detects all variables applied to the selected node(s) on the canvas
  2. Displays them grouped by collection, scope, and mode
  3. Resolves and highlights any aliases used
  4. Handles nested selections and multiple nodes
  5. Edit Values Directly from the Selection
  6. Selection-based variable data is cached with a unique key
  7. Improves performance when switching between nodes
  8. Cache is auto-expired after 5 minutes or can be manually refreshed


Batch Update

  1. Send a list of changes (e.g. 30+ variable updates) in one click
  2. Type conversion (color objects, strings, aliases)
  3. Font loading for FONT_FAMILY variables (with fallback to alternative styles if “Regular” not available)
  4. Scope checks and error recovery per variable
  5. Returns a report of successful and failed updates


Performance Optimizations

  1. In-memory caching of selection data with expiry (5 min)
  2. Caches up to 50 different selections to reduce API calls
  3. Tracks which variables are already loaded to avoid duplication


Figma API Compatibility Handling

  1. Graceful fallback if variable APIs or methods are unavailable
  2. Error messages guide user to fix or retry


Clean, Resizable UI

  1. Fully styled native-like UI with Figma theme support (light/dark)
  2. Flexible layout with resizable panel
  3. Displays progress during data load
  4. Empty states and error messages styled for clarity


Ideal Use Cases

  1. Design system audits
  2. Token cleanup and maintenance
  3. Visual QA of theme modes
  4. Alias linking and optimization
  5. Batch updates to variable values
  6. Color or typography token management


Compatibility

  1. Built for the latest Figma API with full variable support
  2. Works in Figma files only (not FigJam)
  3. Requires Variables feature enabled in your Figma workspace

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Advanced Figma plugin for browsing, editing, and batch-managing local variables, modes, and aliases

plugins.name: FontMaster - Switch every font in one click
plugins.description:
✨ Take control of your typography in Figma — instantly.


FontMaster scans your selected frames or artboards and lists every font used in your design. With an intuitive interface, you can preview and replace any or all fonts across your selection in just a few clicks. Whether you're managing design systems or updating brand fonts, FontMaster ensures consistency without the manual hassle.


🛠️ How to Use

  1. Run the plugin – FontMaster will automatically detect all fonts used in your selection.
  2. Browse detected fonts – View a list of all text styles and fonts present.
  3. Choose a new font – Pick a replacement font for each one or apply one font to all.
  4. Apply changes – Click “Apply” and FontMaster updates everything instantly.


✅ Why Use FontSwap?

  1. Detects all fonts in seconds
  2. Bulk replace fonts with one click
  3. Perfect for design clean-up, brand updates, and system consistency
  4. Saves time on every project

plugins.name: Sustainalyzer
plugins.description:
Sustainalyzer helps you evaluate the ecological impact of your Figma designs. It detects design elements that conflict with the Web Sustainability Guidelines (WSG) and scientific research on digital sustainability.


The plugin checks for the following sustainability issues:


  1. Avoid videos, particularly autoplay or background media
  2. Minimize image use, especially large or excessive images
  3. Optimize images for size, format, and scaling
  4. Avoid third-party services (e.g. embeds, maps, social widgets)
  5. Avoid decorative elements that add visual weight without purpose
  6. Limit font variants to reduce font file size
  7. Prefer system fonts over custom fonts
  8. Reduce complexity by limiting the number of elements
  9. Disable animation autoplay to reduce processor load
  10. Consider older devices, avoiding effects that degrade performance or compatibility
  11. Use a design system to support reuse and reduce redundancy
  12. Choose energy-efficient colors, especially for large UI areas


Each guideline is tagged with an impact level—high, medium, or low—indicating its potential contribution to emissions. You can filter the results by impact level to focus on the most critical issues.


To use Sustainalyzer, simply select the elements you want to analyze and run the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Check your designs for sustainability issues based on the Web Sustainability Guidelines.

plugins.name: Screenshot to 100%
plugins.description:
The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.


On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.

accepted.description: UX/UI/Product designer with more than 10+ years exp.

plugins.name: MoroccanMock
plugins.description:
Design layouts more efficiently by pulling text strings, images, and cultural assets from a unique Moroccan-inspired palette. "moroccanMock" lets you create custom Moroccan-themed content and share it with other Figma users. Collaboration has never been easier!


Content:

Browse or search content to find a collection of Moroccan-inspired text strings, images, and icons. Struggling to find the perfect content? You can create your own text and image assets by using Add.


Add:

Create text categories and populate them with your own text strings. You can also upload up to 20 PNGs or JPEGs to create image content. As a creator, you may choose to share it publicly or keep it private. When you create content, it is automatically pinned to the Home Screen for quick access (signed-in users only).


Customize Your Home Screen:

Optimize your workflow by pinning the content that you use most to your home screen. Apply 1-click access to any content type with the switch of a toggle (signed-in users only). Drag and drop items on your home screen to suit your preferences.


How to use moroccanMock:

Find content:

Access saved content from your Home Screen or navigate through the tabs to search or browse content. Pin it for ease of access to your home screen.


Applying text content:

Select one or more text layers in your design to apply strings individually or apply them all. Use the original order provided or choose an order from the drop-down menu.


Applying image content:

Select one or more image layers or frames in your design, then apply the images individually or apply them all in random order.


Applying icon content:

Browse the collection or use the search bar to find a Moroccan icon. Click on the icon or drag and drop it into your design. You can also adjust the icon size to scale as needed.


Creating text and image content:

Navigate to the Add tab, click Add, and select content type. Provide a Title relevant to your content. Set your content to Public or Private. See the terms and conditions regarding usage and rights.


Anwar Bahou

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/bahouanwar
plugins.tagline: Bring Moroccan Culture to Your Designs – Instantly

plugins.name: Draft Alpha
plugins.description:
DraftAlpha – Figma Plugin

Deliver consistent UX content aligned with your brand guidelines


DraftAlpha enables you to effortlessly create, collaborate, and maintain brand-consistent UX content directly within Figma.


Key Features:


✅ AI-powered Brand Guidelines Builder

- Instantly generate tailored brand guidelines, including writing rules, tone of voice, target audience, and brand pillars.

- Customize guidelines precisely to reflect your brand identity.


✅ Content Consistency & Compliance

- Automatically check content for adherence to your established brand guidelines.

- Generate multiple content variants aligned with your brand.


✅ Centralized Content & Collaboration

- Single source of truth for all UX copy and team collaboration.

plugins.name: FigWP - Figma to WordPress Converter
plugins.description:
Figma to WordPress plugin effortlessly converts Figma designs into Elementor & Essential Addons for Elementor widgets for WordPress, maintaining the integrity of styling, dimensions, and content. It bridges the gap between design and development, allowing teams to work more efficiently.


Key Highlights:


  1. 15+ Elementor Widgets – Compatible with all essential Elementor widgets.
  2. Instant Conversion – Real-time processing with visual updates.
  3. Style Consistency – Retains colors, fonts, spacing, and overall design integrity.


How It Works:


  1. API Integration – Set up your Figma API key for seamless connectivity.
  2. Naming Standards – Adhere to specific naming conventions for best performance.
  3. Select Layers – Pick the frames or components you want to convert.
  4. Automated Conversion – Let the tool process your selection, with live progress updates.
  5. Export Options – Copy the JSON code or download it directly for WordPress integration.


Usage Guidelines:


Follow these essential steps to ensure everything works smoothly:


Use a valid and active Figma API key.

Confirm you have edit access to the file.

Use ‘Auto Layout’ wherever possible to avoid design breakage.

Use ‘Containers’ if column layout breaks (optional but helpful).

All Sections & Inner Sections must contain ‘Columns’.

Frames or layers must be named using our supported Elementor widget names:


  1. Container
  2. Button
  3. Heading
  4. Text Editor
  5. Creative Button
  6. Dual Color Heading
  7. Advanced Menu
  8. Advanced Menu → Menu → Menu Active
  9. Call to Action
  10. Info Box
  11. Post Carousel
  12. Testimonial
  13. Feature List
  14. Counter → Number
  15. Logo Carousel
  16. Woo Product List
  17. Content
  18. Image
  19. Subheading
  20. Rating

accepted.description: With 6+ million users, Startise is the dynamic parent company of top 5 brands in industry (WPDeveloper, Storeware, xCloud & more) to help you get success.

plugins.name: Contrast Checker Pro
plugins.description:
🎨 Advanced Contrast Checker


🎨 Advanced Contrast Checker – Smart Contrast Analysis for Accessible Design


Take your design’s accessibility to the next level.


Advanced Contrast Checker: is a plugin built to detect and analyze contrast issues, even in complex scenarios like elements with **image backgrounds**.


🧠 Key Features:


1. 🎯 Accurate Detection


  1. Automatically identifies when an element has an **image as a background.
  2. Checks the layer hierarchy, scanning parent elements if necessary.


2. 📢 Clear and Visual Feedback


  1. Displays a prominent message when an image background is detected.
  2. Indicates that the contrast ratio is an approximation, offering a helpful reference.
  3. Includes visual icons for better clarity and user understanding.


3. 🌍 Multilingual Support


  1. Available in English, Spanish, and Chinese.
  2. Automatically switches language based on your Figma settings.


4. 🤖 Intelligent Behavior


  1. No color suggestions are shown when the background is an image.
  2. Uses a light gray approximation** to estimate contrast without misleading results.



Designed for creators who care about building **visually inclusive and accessible interfaces**, without compromising on precision or speed.


With 🎨 Advanced Contrast Checker accessibility becomes a natural part of your design workflow.
plugins.tagline: Smart contrast checking, even with image backgrounds.

plugins.name: Typographica
plugins.description:
Typographica helps you quickly create beautiful and balanced font combinations for any project — from corporate dashboards to creative websites.


The plugin analyzes your chosen primary font, project style, and font metrics to generate harmonious font pairs automatically.


What does Typographica do?


  1. Generates Primary + Secondary + Accent font combinations
  2. Takes into account your project style (7 styles: business, corporate, modern, elegant, fun, personal, minimalist)
  3. Analyzes font metrics (x-height, glyph width, weight, stylistic characteristics)
  4. Automatically filters out fonts that do not fit the selected style
  5. Lets you save combinations as Figma text styles and variables
  6. Optionally adds smart descriptions to generated styles
  7. Supports manual swapping of secondary and accent fonts
  8. Works with any available fonts — Google Fonts, local fonts, and Figma-supported fonts


Who is it for?


  1. Product designers — to quickly build solid typography systems
  2. UX/UI designers — to improve readability and visual rhythm
  3. Brand designers — to find well-balanced and creative font pairs
  4. Beginners — to get guidance on what fonts work well together
  5. Experienced designers — to save time and explore unexpected combinations


How does it work?


  1. Choose your project style
  2. Select a Primary Font
  3. Click Change Pairs
  4. Browse the generated font pairs and accent options
  5. Save styles or variables in one click
  6. Tweak and refine as needed


Why use Typographica?


Save time — no more manual font pairing

Get better quality — pairs are based on font metrics and style fit, not guesswork

Flexible — works for classic and modern designs alike

Customizable — easy to adjust pairs or generate new ones on the fly


Styles and Tokens Support


Typographica not only generates font pairs, but also helps you create full-fledged text styles and design tokens in Figma.


You can save your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts as reusable Text Styles and optionally as Variables (Tokens) — making your typography consistent across your project and design system.


Style Description Table


Typographica can automatically generate a style description table for your font system — right inside Figma.


It creates a clear, editable table summarizing your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts, with suggested usage and style notes.


Perfect for documenting typography choices or sharing with your team and developers.


Typographica is your smart font pairing assistant in Figma. Make your typography cleaner, more beautiful, and more consistent — with less effort.

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Smart Font Pair Generator for Figma

Slide Auto-Numbering


This plugin automatically numbers your Figma Slides. Wherever a TEXT layer named “page number” exists, it will be overwritten with the correct slide index (1, 2, 3, …).


How to use:

• Ensure each slide has a TEXT layer named “page number.”

• Run the plugin (Plugins → Development → Slide Auto-Numbering → Run).

• The plugin will number the slides linearly in the order provided by Figma Slides.

Your ultimate Figma Variables exporter & manager to rule your tokens.


Stop manually transcribing design tokens! adamantium token lab bridges the gap between your Figma Variables and your codebase, streamlining your design-to-development workflow with unparalleled power and flexibility.


Whether you're working with a simple project or a complex multi-library design system, adamantium token lab gives you the tools to view, manage, analyze, and export your design tokens exactly how you need them. Say goodbye to errors, inconsistencies, and wasted time.


Why You Need adamantium token lab:

  1. Bridge the Design-Dev Gap: Seamlessly translate your Figma Variables into production-ready code.
  2. Ensure Consistency: Maintain a single source of truth for your design tokens across all projects.
  3. Boost Efficiency: Automate token exports, saving hours and reducing manual errors.
  4. Unmatched Customization: Tailor token output to perfectly match your team's coding standards.
  5. Maintain a Clean Design System: Understand token usage, identify unused variables, and keep your system tidy.
  6. Empower Collaboration: Provide developers with exactly what they need, in their preferred format.
  7. Handle Complexity with Ease: Advanced features like comprehensive library alias resolution simplify managing large-scale design systems.



Core Features:

Token Viewing & Management:

  1. View all Figma Variables (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) in a dynamic, resizable table.
  2. See token names, descriptions, types, and values per mode at a glance.
  3. Toggle in-table alias resolution to see actual values directly.
  4. Customize the display format for color values (HEX, RGBA, HSLA, etc.) in the table.
  5. Easily filter and view tokens from specific collections.


Powerful & Highly Customizable Export Engine:

  1. Export to CSS Custom Properties.
  2. Export to SASS Variables ($var).
  3. Export to SASS Maps (Nested or Flat options available).
  4. Export to JSON (Structured or Nested, with options for flat key paths).
  5. Export a developer-friendly Intermediate Representation (IR) for custom workflows.
  6. Apply naming conventions: camelCase, PascalCase, kebab-case, snake_case, and more.
  7. Add custom prefixes and suffixes to token names or filenames.
  8. Define custom path separators for token names (e.g., -, _, .).
  9. Output colors in various formats: HEX, HEX8, RGB(A), HSL(A), HSB(A).
  10. Configure numeric units (px, rem, em, pt) and base font size for rem/em.
  11. Choose your alias strategy: embed resolved values or reference original variables/map keys.
  12. Optionally include collection and mode names in exported variable names.
  13. Include token descriptions as comments in your exported code.
  14. Output JSON color values as strings or structured objects.
  15. Customize CSS mode selector templates (e.g., :root[data-theme="$MODE"]).
  16. See an instant live preview of your export with syntax highlighting.
  17. Download generated token files easily.


Advanced Token Usage Analysis:

  1. Identify which design tokens are actively used in your Figma designs.
  2. Analyze token usage on the "Current Page" or across the "Entire File".
  3. View a "Used" column in the token table for clear visual indicators.
  4. See updated collection counts showing (used / total) tokens after analysis.
  5. View a prominent banner confirming the scope and results of the last analysis.
  6. Filter the token list to show "All," "Used," or "Unused" tokens.


Deep Library Integration (All Features Currently Enabled):

  1. Effortlessly work with variables from your enabled Figma libraries.
  2. See clear indicators for the source library of your collections, including the library name where available.
  3. Includes powerful, deep alias resolution across external libraries – essential for complex design systems, ensuring your exported values are always accurate.
  4. The UI intuitively displays information about library-linked aliases with distinct styling, providing full clarity in your token management.


Get Started with adamantium token lab Today!

Take control of your design tokens, accelerate your development process, and ensure unparalleled consistency across your projects. Install adamantium token lab and transform your Figma Variables workflow!



🌱 This is a Beta Version!

adamantium token lab is currently in active development and is being released as a Beta version. This means that while we've worked hard to make it powerful and stable, you might encounter occasional bugs or quirks.


Your Feedback is Gold! 🪙

We are incredibly passionate about making adamantium token lab the best token management tool for you, and your experience and insights are crucial to this journey. As you use the plugin, please help us improve by:


  1. Reporting any bugs or issues you encounter.
  2. Sharing your feature requests and ideas for new functionality.
  3. Letting us know what you love and what could be even better.


Your feedback will directly shape the future of adamantium token lab, helping us to squash bugs, refine features, and build the ultimate token workflow tool. We're committed to regular updates and improvements based on your input.
plugins.tagline: analyze, organize, name, export, cleanup. One token lab to rule your tokens (figma variables).

plugins.name: Thai Spell Checker - พ่อขุนเช็ก (AI Powered) - Beta
plugins.description:
🏰 พ่อขุนเช็ก - ตัวช่วยเช็กภาษาไทยสุดแม่น ที่ทำให้การทำงานง่าย สนุก และดูโปรฯ กว่าเดิม!


✨ จุดเด่นของพ่อขุนเช็ก

* เช็กภาษาไทยแม่นยำระดับโปร : ใช้ AI ตรวจสอบการสะกดและบริบทไทยแบบละเอียด ครบทุกจุด

* สรุปผลไว สนุก และเข้าใจง่าย : ระบบให้คะแนนพร้อมแนะนำแบบเข้าใจง่าย สนุก เหมือนมีพ่อขุนรามคำแหงมาคอยติวส่วนตัว

* ใช้งานง่ายในคลิกเดียว : เลือกเฟรม/ข้อความ แล้วคลิกเดียวจบ ไม่ต้องเสียเวลาย้ายแพลตฟอร์ม

* ประหยัดเวลาทำงานจริง : ไม่ต้องเช็กทีละคำ ตรวจจบในรอบเดียว พร้อมใช้งานทันที


🎯 เหมาะกับใคร

* UX Writer สาย Copy ไทย

* ทีม Marketing ที่สร้าง Content ไทย

* Designer/ทีม Product ที่ต้องการงานไทยไร้ที่ติใน Figma


🚀 เริ่มใช้งานง่ายสุด ๆ

1. เลือกข้อความที่ต้องการเช็ก

2. เปิด Plugin “Thai Spell Checker - พ่อขุนเช็ก (AI Powered)” ใน Figma

3. รับผลตรวจและคำแนะนำทันที! ทำให้การเช็กภาษาไทยไม่ใช่เรื่องน่าเบื่ออีกต่อไป


เพียงคลิกเดียว งานภาษาไทยของคุณจะไร้ที่ติ ดูมืออาชีพ และประหยัดเวลากว่าที่เคย!
plugins.tagline: เช็คการสะกดภาษาไทยด้วย AI แบบสนุกๆ สไตล์พ่อขุนรามคำแหง พร้อมให้คะแนนแบบโบราณ

plugins.name: AI Alt Text Generator
plugins.description:
# Figma Plugin: AI Alt Text Generator


AI Alt Text Generatorは、Figma上で選択した画像に対してGoogle GeminiまたはOpenAIのAIを使い、アクセシブルな代替テキスト（altテキスト）を自動生成するFigmaプラグインです。


---


## 機能概要

- **Gemini（Google）またはOpenAI Vision API**を利用し、画像内容に応じたaltテキストを自動生成

- **日本語・英語のUI/プロンプト切り替え**（画面右上のボタンで即時反映）

- **APIキーはFigmaのclientStorageに安全に保存**

- **複数候補（1～5件）を一度に生成し、編集・選択可能**

- **キーワード指定**で生成内容をカスタマイズ

- **画像プレビュー**とステータス表示

- **エラー時の明確なフィードバック**


---


## セットアップ

1. プラグインをFigmaにインストールします。

2. [Google Gemini APIキー](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) または [OpenAI APIキー](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys) を取得します。

3. プラグインを起動し、設定タブでAPIキーを入力・保存してください。


---


## 使い方

1. **Figmaキャンバス上で画像ノードを選択**

2. 「Altテキスト生成」タブで「画像を解析」ボタンをクリック

3. 画像プレビューとサイズが表示されます

4. 必要に応じてキーワード（日本語は読点「、」区切り、英語はカンマ区切り）や候補数を指定

5. 「代替テキストを生成する」ボタンをクリック

6. 候補リストが表示され、各候補は編集可能

7. 必要に応じて内容をコピーし、プロジェクトの代替テキスト欄等に貼り付けてご利用ください


---


## 言語切り替え

- 画面右上の「日本語 | English」ボタンでUI・プロンプト・説明文が即座に切り替わります。


---


## APIキーについて

- GeminiまたはOpenAIのAPIキーが必要です（どちらか一方でも可。両方入力時はGeminiが優先されます）

- APIキーはFigmaのclientStorageに安全に保存されます

- 無料枠や利用制限については各サービスの公式情報をご確認ください


---


## 注意事項

- このプラグインは選択画像の内容を外部AIサービス（Google Gemini/OpenAI）に送信します。プライバシーや機密情報の取り扱いにご注意ください。

- 生成されるaltテキストはAIによる自動生成のため、最終的な内容はご自身でご確認ください。


---


## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1–5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "、" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "日本語 | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.
plugins.tagline: AI Alt Text Generatorは、Figma上で選択した画像に対してGoogle GeminiまたはOpenAIのAIを使い、アクセシブルな代替テキスト（altテキスト）を自動生成します。

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "、" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "日本語 | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.
132361.tagline: AI Alt Text Generatorは、Figma上で選択した画像に対してGoogle GeminiまたはOpenAIのAIを使い、アクセシブルな代替テキスト（altテキスト）を自動生成します。

plugins.name: Bulk Renamer
plugins.description:
Bulk Renamer 2.0


A powerful, user-friendly tool for renaming multiple frames or components in one go.


Bulk Renamer 2.0 lets you paste a list of names (typed manually, copied from Excel, or generated elsewhere) and instantly apply them to your selected frames — in the exact order and direction you choose.


⸻


✨ Features:

•Rename frames by typing or pasting names

•Smart support for Excel/Sheets cell pastes

•Auto-adds commas only when you press Enter

•Supports left-to-right or top-to-bottom frame direction

•Real-time validation for name count vs frame selection

•Clean, dark-themed UI with live feedback


⸻


🪄 How to use:

1.Select your frames/components in Figma

2.Choose your naming direction

3.Paste or type names (one per line)

4.Click Apply to rename all selected items

✨ Colors to Variables


Save time and stay organized by turning your color swatches into Figma variables — automatically.


How it works:

•Select one or more frames or components

•Each must include a solid fill

•Each must contain a text layer named “Name” (this becomes the variable name)


Your palette, variable-ready.


Perfect for building or maintaining design systems with consistent, reusable color variables.

plugins.name: Carregar Tabloide de Produtos - St. Marche
plugins.description: This plugin fetches product data from a JSON API and dynamically displays them within the interface. It processes the retrieved information, ensuring that each product is presented following the existing card style of the application. Additionally, the plugin maintains visual consistency by adapting product details such as name, price, and image to fit seamlessly into the predefined layout. This approach simplifies integration with various data sources, providing a uniform and cohesive user experience.
